attributes.action: Police on duty, should be able to wear black Union Jack for fallen Officers
attributes.additional_details: The Commissioner of the Metropolitan Police has stated that no officer can wear this badge on their uniform as "it is not part of the uniform". So does this also apply to Poppies? We commemorate our dead and this is a respectful way to do it.
attributes.background: In the last few years several officers have been murdered in the line of duty and a memorial badge has been designed, comprising a black Union Jack with a "thin blue line" running through it.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This decision was taken by the Metropolitan Police Service, which is the responsibility of the London Mayor's Office for Policing and Crime (MOPAC). MOPAC is overseen by the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
